p:
The antioxidant activity of EEB and EEL was evaluated by the method of Sharma et al. [ 47] using the free radical 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH). Ethanolic solution of DPPH (0.11 mM, 1800 μL) was incubated with 200 μL of the positive controls, ascorbic acid, and hydroxybutyltoluene (BHT) or EEB and EEL at concentrations of 0.1-2000 μg/mL in 80% ethanol. After 30 min of incubation at ambient temperature (protected from light), the absorbance was read using a spectrophotometer (Quimis, Diadema, SP, Brazil) at 517 nm; the absorbance of each sample was transformed into free radical inhibition percent using formula ( 1). Three independent experiments were performed in triplicate.
(1)
Radical scavenging
%
=
Abs control − Abs sample

× 100 .
